data.title: Best workflow for viewing PR in VSCode?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|theme-sapphire|Tyriar|0.2.1|
|quokka-vscode|WallabyJs|1.0.36|
|nord-visual-studio-code|arcticicestudio|0.3.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.19.1|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.5|
|vetur|octref|0.8.5|
|java|redhat|0.6.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.4.1|
|language-stylus|sysoev|1.7.3|
|vim|vscodevim|0.9.0|;


---

@bpasero 
I remember previously you talked about how you views large PR in VSCode instead of GitHub for diff and easier jumping around. Wondering if you mind sharing your workflow, or is there any extension you are using.

I was trying to achieve that by checking out PR in a branch, `git reset HEAD~10` if the PR has 10 commits. But that's problematic if the PR merges in master or do updates. Also if I want to push changes to PR, I can't do a commit again and has to reclone that branch.

Thinking it'd be awesome to add a Custom View to Git Viewlet for reviewing / switching-between PR seamlessly.

/cc @Microsoft/vscode Also would like to learn how you are reviewing PRs!

data.title: Extension doesn't recognize installation or updates
data.body:
I developed an extension called "Git Merger" and for some reason even after you install it and you go back to the marketplace you will see it with an install button next to it.
Furthermore, the extension doesn't notify you when there is an update, and if you search for it in the marketplace you see the latest version with an install button instead of update
I checked this on several different computers and it happened in all of them.

I'm using: 
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1 (1.13.1)
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.5 (16F73)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Download the extension.
2. Go back to the marketplace and see install sign even after closing vscode and reopening.

Steps to Reproduce update issue: 
1. Download the extension.
2. Wait a couple of days for my extension update (or ping me so I'll push a new version)
3. No notification or update button

data.title: Typescript errors appearing out of nowhere, changing language mode back and forth makes them disappear
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|vscode-css-formatter|aeschli|0.0.2|
|vscode-angular2-files|alexiv|1.3.8|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.3.3|
|tsimporter|pmneo|1.2.14|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Code
2. Errors suddenly appear even if there are none
3. How to fix temporarily:
4. Change language mode to something else
5. Switch back to Typescript and they will be gone
6. Keep coding and they will appear again
7. Go to Step 4 and repeat

This started happening 3 days ago not sure if update broke it

data.title: Feature Request: Optionally group editor tabs based on file type, color-coding the tab groups with muted colors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.3.4|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.3.0|
|wallaby-vscode|WallabyJs|1.0.51|
|vscode-color|anseki|0.4.1|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|gitlens|eamodio|4.1.3|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.5|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.10|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|color-highlight|naumovs|2.2.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|
|blade-runner|yukidoi|1.0.0|;


---

It would be nice if editor tabs could be grouped according to file type (by that I mean _file extension_).  In other words, all `.js` files together; all `.scss` files together, etc.  The tabs in the group should then be color-coded with muted colors (configurable colors later in a future release).

When I'm working with multiple files of the same type (say, jumping between modularized SCSS files), I have to jump all over the UI to find my open files (of the same file type).

Thank you for your consideration.

Eric

data.title: Support moving the debugger cursor to another line
data.body:
In the regular Visual Studio you can drag/drop the debugger cursor, for example to go back a few lines and execute these again after altering some local variable.

It seems that this is not supported by VS Code.

Supporting this would make us much more productive if you can fiddle around in a piece of code without needing to start over debugging completely.

data.title: Improved auto-indent breaks Allman style indent
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (779a7dfa682e31d870680caea572a11d009ab447, 2017-06-23T05:59:57.891Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

---

While working on adding support for the improved auto-indent mentioned [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4039#issuecomment-309484522) to the Haxe extension, I noticed it doesn't work well with Allman bracket style (`{` in new line). This is the behavior for both TS and JS:

![](http://i.imgur.com/EOuE1eZ.gif)

The expected behavior would be to un-indent again when the `{` is typed, take Sublime for example:

![](http://i.imgur.com/flMPgZS.gif)

The `Reindent lines` command also produces incorrect indentation for lines that are already typed:

![](http://i.imgur.com/aKtcfO8.gif)

data.title: Re-rendering hover content DOM elements even when nothing changed

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
I noticed that VS Code is re-creating hover DOM elements every time a user's mouse moves even a pixel, and even if the hover content is exactly the same.

I've created a short PR to check for equal contents before disposing and re-creating the document fragment: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/29387

To illustrate the difference, I added a `console.log` whenever the `ModesContentHoverWidget._renderMessages` method is called. 
See a video of how it behaves currently: https://cl.ly/2X2k0O1Z370q
And a video of how it behaves with my PR: https://cl.ly/0I15253M142X

Note: this change is currently live on Sourcegraph (e.g. https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/Microsoft/vscode/-/blob/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/workbench.ts#L148-149)

data.title: Don't re-render hovers if nothing has changed; Add telemetry on hovers
data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29388

>To illustrate the difference, I added a console.log whenever the `ModesContentHoverWidget._renderMessages` method is called.
> See a video of how it behaves currently: https://cl.ly/2X2k0O1Z370q
> And a video of how it behaves with my PR: https://cl.ly/0I15253M142X

The first commit adds the check for equality
The second commit adds telemetry for every hover

I'd be happy to kill the 2nd if you prefer it

data.title: Allow customization of the pop-up documentation box during auto-complete
data.body:
It is currently impossible to resize the documentation box or change its font size - it is not controllable by the upcoming `suggestFontSize` either. This leads to awkward situations where the documentation has a lot of line breaks and becomes unreadable:

![screenshot from 2017-06-24 19-59-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/918661/27511245-ba386530-5917-11e7-963c-18beffa420ad.png)

I propose the addition of a variable that controls the documentation's font size and one that allows to scale the boundaries of the documentation box by a scalar.

data.title: Ctrl+Delete deletes whitespace plus token in VS Keymap
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)

|Extension|Author|Version|

|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.3.4|
|vscode-nuget-package-manager|jmrog|1.1.3|

|vs-keybindings|ms-vscode|0.1.3|;


---
I pasted method into the editor but the formatting was off and there were too many spaces before the method name.  I used Ctrl+Home to return to the beginning of the line and the pressed Ctrl+Delete with the intention of deleting all whitespace and then pressing my tab key to indent.  Unfortunately, the Ctrl+Delete deleted all the whitespace and the method name.  I would expect it to delete all whitespace up to, but not including, the method name.
Steps to Reproduce:

1.
2.

data.title: Git origin/branches are not removed when removed from Github
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: the listing length exceeds browsers' URL characters limit
---

I create a repository on Github, create branches, and push up those branches. When I click the checkout button for git branches, I see

```
master
branch1
branch2
origin/master
origin/branch1
origin/branch2
```

After deleting local branches and origin branches from Github, I still see

```
master
origin/master
origin/branch1
origin/branch2
```

Despite the fact that the remote branches have been deleted. The current workaround is to remove the remote and then add it back again.

data.title: VSCode 1.13.1 ships with insecure node.dll 7.4.0
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1 [379d2ef ](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89) 
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VSCode 1.13.1
2. Check version of C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\node.dll

See https://nodejs.org/en/blog/vulnerability/openssl-january-2017/

It also causes reports in desktop vulnerability scanners like Secunia PSI.
http://www.flexerasoftware.de/enterprise/products/software-vulnerability-management/personal-software-inspector/

PSI recommends to use Node v7.5.0.

data.title: Expanded entry inside collapsed entry only shows children after collapsing & expanding (custom tree views)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create an extension with a custom tree provider
2. Have a tree where the top-level node is collapsed, and it has one children which is expanded and has itself a couple of children
3. Observe that when you click on the top-level node to expand it, then the little arrow on the child is in the "expanded" state, but no children are display. After collapsing and re-expanding, the children appear.

4. set the cursor in this exact text and launch the show hover command with the command palette : the info is showing
5. press the shortcut ctrl+k, ctrl+i : the info is showing and vanish instantly

data.title: Enhancement: Stop the Misuse of the Pointing Hand Cursor

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The UI of Code always gives me a uncomfortable feeling. I finally realized this is because of the faulty cursor.
**All the buttons, as well as the tabs and the list items**, use the **pointing hand cursor**![](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/input-and-devices/images/cursor-pointinghand.png), which shouldn't be used. [A guideline of Windows](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dn742466.aspx#hand) states that this cursor is **used for text and graphics links because of their weak affordance**. [Another one](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/input-and-devices/mouse-interactions#cursors) recommends us to **use hover effects** for clickable elements instead (currently we have hover effects for list items and some of the buttons, but not for tabs). It's the same [for other platforms](https://developer.apple.com/macos/human-interface-guidelines/input-and-output/mouse-and-trackpad#pointers).
I hope we can change them into the default arrow cursor ![](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/uwp/input-and-devices/images/cursor-arrow.png) and get a fix on this soon.

data.title: Application icon is incorrect in Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `1.13.1
379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89`
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download a fresh copy of VS Code in .deb package form
2. Install with `sudo dpkg -i [filename].deb`
3. Icon is incorrect (shows generic editor icon when a specific VS code icon is available in the icon themes)

Fix: edit `/usr/share/code.desktop`. Change `icon=code` to `icon=visualstudiocode`

data.title: "End" key should move to the real line end on first press

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|jquerysnippets|donjayamanne|0.0.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|php-debug|felixfbecker|1.10.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set "editor.wordWrap": "on",
2. Focus a long line
3. press 'End' key

How can  I  move to the position 2?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16248887/27504981-758770ca-58c7-11e7-9f8f-b70535bf59df.png)
